conclusion: To find the magnitude of the pressure exerted by the sled on the ground, we need to consider the forces acting on the sled and the ground.
The forces acting on the sled are the force of the adult pulling the sled and the force of the ground pushing the sled.
The force of the adult pulling the sled is given as 100N and the angle at which the force is applied is 37° above the horizontal.
The force of the ground pushing the sled is the force of gravity acting on the sled, which is mg where m is the mass of the sled and g is the acceleration due to gravity.
The force of gravity acting on the sled is mg = 30kg × 10m/s² = 300N.

conclusion: The horizontal component of the force of the adult pulling the sled is F = 100N × cos37° = 100N × 0.8 = 80N.

premise: The force of gravity acting on the sled is 300N.
conclusion: The force of the ground pushing the sled is 300N.

conclusion: The vertical component of the force of the adult pulling the sled is F_vertical = 100N × sin37° = 100N × 0.6 = 60N.

conclusion: The net force exerted by the sled on the ground is 300N - 60N = 240N.
